data.title: Down to earth produce
data.text:
It is great to be able to get meat that is not grain fed and chicken that is free range.
I reminds me of when I was young and getting the produce straight from the field.

data.title: Lots of interesting items
data.text: Small but nice. Food trucks available. No crafts, clothing or jewelry. Took us about 1 hour to look around

data.title: Best way to spend a Saturday morning!
data.text:
Unlike many Farmers markets I've been to, this market actually sells produce along with great vendors, and food trucks The market is open year-round every Sat morning. Because of the climate here in the Phx area we can grow produce most of the year and fall/winter is my favorite season because citrus is on! 
My only regret is that I didn't start visiting the market sooner. It is well run and attracts some great growers and vendors. I'm all about supporting local small businesses and this is a great way to do that. 
Plus the setting is in Downtown Gilbert which is an amazing place to go for some top-notch restaurants.

data.title: Excellent food and Quality
data.text: It's nice to know there are restaurants close by that you can count on for consistent quality ingredients coupled with a pleasant ambiance

data.title: Often have daily good specials and of course very fresh ingredients.  Reasonable prices and quality food.
data.text: I traveled to Tulsa Ok. on Southwest and as always it was a very good flight in spite of bad weather.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Very small market which we walked around in about 10 minutes but we did find a stand called 4grins that does organic tooth powder There was a balloon lady that made incredible animal for the kids

data.title: Great Place for Fresh Produce and Products
data.text: Lots of parking. Many great vendors for fresh produce and other products. Get there early for the best deals (and to stay out of the heat)!

data.title: Nice
data.text: Always like this farmers market. Has a bit of everything and considering it is in downtown Gilbert,  it is surprisingly diverse and not pretentious.  It sort of doesn't fit, but it is great. Live the salt couple,  sausage guy, and hot sauce brothers to best.

data.title: This isn't a REAL Farmer's Market!
data.text: If your thing is overpriced goods then you're in the right place here!  While these are supposed to be "Home Grown" I think most people there grab their goods at Walmart first...the produce is nothing different, except the prices.

data.title: Nice little market, very pet friendly!
data.text: This market was a little smaller then I thought it would be.  There's tons of parking nearby which makes this a great market to check out.  I saw lots of dogs there so it's really pet friendly if you'd like to bring your little four legged critter.  I'm not sure when this shuts down for the year but it's worth checking out.

data.title: Sunday Excursion
data.text: If you are looking for organic - good for your health jellies, salsas, veggies, goats milk lotions...this is the place to go.

data.title: Great Saturday morning activity!
data.text: Stroll through the farmers market in sunny old town Gilbert, and be tantalized by the wonderful smells, tastes and sights to behold by the amazingly creative , talented vendors! After sampling  the wares, stocking up on fresh veggies and organic meats, all natural soaps ,  you can enjoy a meal from one of the several food trucks . There is even face painting for the kiddies! Definitely a great casual Saturday  morning outing.

data.title: Growing farmers market
data.text: We try to get to the Gilbert Farmers Market at least once a month.  Lately it seems to have gotten bigger each time with many new vendors.  It has a great selection of vendors from produce to food trucks to miscellaneous items.  So glad it is walking distance.

data.title: Great options
data.text: The Gilber Farmer's Market is the place to go for your organic foods, but to also enjoy music, and non food items to go home.  Don't forget to check out the food trucks.

data.title: If you are free on Saturday mornings - or weekday nights this is for you
data.text:
In the old town section, Saturday's get together is a wonderful collection of beautiful creative people with delicious ideas and delicious food. Take a stroll. Well worth your time, plenty of free parking, and this won't cost you anything to look.

During the weekend nights by the Theatre down the road about a mile, you can also get the best of local farm fruits and veggies. Who doesn't want that? Local is better for you.

data.title: Terrific Farmers market  with large variety
data.text: This market has lots to offer whatever your looking for!  Vegetables, meats, lots of treats and eats. Also has a number of food trucks. Once a month has craft fair as well.

data.title: no organics
data.text: too many vendors with uninteresting overpriced items.  no organic fruit and veg.  not dog friendly.  wasn't impressed

data.title: Needs to Grow
data.text: Farmers Markets are always fun but this one needs some more participation. Fun as always but could use morevendors.

data.title: Lots of choices
data.text: A lot of food choices and many different vendors with all sorts of great items from coffee to Salmon to honey and many more, definitely worth going.Open every Saterday 8-12 winter and 7-11 summer hours.

data.title: Year-round deliciousness
data.text: If you are in Gilbert, Arizona on a Saturday make this a stop on your list. Loaded with delicious vendors, this market always had fresh produce but also local meats, sauces, food trucks, and handcrafted products. Around the holidays there are also weeks where art vendors are invited as well. We love it.
